reviews.review: the unit cost $ 275 to start with , so it is not worth repairing .

the computer has difficulty switching between tablet and computer .
2 / 28 / 18 - a couple days ago i updated the chrome os .
it ' s just that chrome doesn ' t work the same with a chromebook as it does with windows .
hopefully in 10 years they ' ll have this figured out and it won ' t suck so badly .
bought this last year on july .
i rarely use the keyboard .
- great price for a touchscreen chromebook
it is glitchy , and barely usable .
i ordered one , the touch pad failed to work consistently .
i often find i ' ve typed an entire sentence ( or more ) with my fingers on the wrong keys , which is very unproductive when trying to take real - time notes in a meeting !
i know it only takes a few seconds , but a new device should not be doing this and makes me question if it ' ll get worse in the future .
i also have to press the trackpad very hard for left click ( not as badly as the first unit , though ) , and i lost right click functionality on the track pad 2 days into my voyage with this thing .
i tried factory resetting after i updated the os , and it still drained 9 % over 8 hours .
hdmi out doesn ' t work right .
they had it over a week and then shipped back .
i was excited to receive this chromebook , only to watch that excitement dissipate within mere hours as i noticed the touchscreen did n ' t work at all on tablet mode .
clearly there is some kind of major defect here that acer has n ' t resolved .
i bought this for my daughter to use to take online classes while she ' s overseas in europe for a year .
